titles.title: Congratulating the Detroit Shock for winning the 2003 Women's National Basketball Association championship.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization Discharged.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mrs. Miller (MI) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 392.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 401 - 0 (Roll no. 43).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/9/2004--Passed House without amendment. Congratulates the Detroit Shock for winning the 2003 Women's National Basketball championship, the eight Women's National Basketball Association teams who played in the post-season, and the Los Angeles Sparks for their performance during the playoff finals.
